title: Retail Sales Rebound After 3 Weak Months, Hitting A Record High
text: Retail Sales Rebound After 3 Weak Months, Hitting A Record High

title: Market Recap: Wednesday, February 17: Is it time to get ready for a dip?
text: Stocks fell Wednesday to retreat from record highs, even after new data showed retail sales surged at the fastest clip since June at the start of the year. The Nasdaq shed more than 1% as tech stocks underperformed, and the index was on track for its worst session of February so far.

title: Stocks: When is the right time to rebalance your portfolio?
text: Yahoo Finance's Seana Smith spoke with Omar Aguilar, Charles Schwab Investment Management SVP and CIO of Passive Equities & Multi-asset Strategies about the outlook for the markets, rebalancing investment portfolios, and risk. Subscribe to Yahoo Finance: https://yhoo.it/2fGu5Bb About Yahoo Finance: At Yahoo Finance, you get free stock quotes, up-to-date news, portfolio management resources, international market data, social interaction and mortgage rates that help you manage your financial life.

title: Pimco: Dollar May Weaken Slightly Against EM Currencies
text: Feb.17 -- Erin Browne, multi-asset portfolio manager at Pacific Investment Management Co., discusses the outlook for equity, fixed income and currency markets. She speaks with Haslinda Amin and Rishaad Salamat on "Bloomberg Markets: Asia.

title: Asian high-yield bonds are one of our favorite investments in credit space: UBS
text: Adrian Zuercher from UBS Global Wealth Management says equities are more attractive than bonds in the current market environment, and Asian junk bonds are better investments in the credit space.

title: Gary Vaynerchuk says GameStop frenzy was just the beginning of investing in the digital age
text: "I look at us as cavemen and women in the digital age," said Gary Vaynerchuk, the CEO of VaynerMedia who has a track record of investing in emerging technologies.

title: GameStop, Tesla: Do Asset-Bubbles Exist? Can They Be Managed?
text: The financial press has been dominated by two similar-but-different “bubble” stories: Tesla﻿﻿, and GameStop. But they do not fit the bubble pattern.

title: We Don't Lack Opportunities to Deploy Our Capital: ARK's Brett Winton
text: Feb.17 -- Cathie Wood's Ark Investment Management now manages more than $60 billion, as funds flow into Wood's exchange-traded funds at the fastest pace ever. Last week alone, the Ark family added almost $3.8 billion with five of its funds notching record weeks of inflows.

title: Stock Market ETFs Trading Update: Key Price Support Levels
text: Wednesday could be a pivotal day for the market. With a gap down in the major indices the market continued to sell-off until finding some late-day support, especially in the Dow Jones Industrials which closed green.

title: Interactive Brokers chair says financial system came ‘dangerously close' to failure during GameStop mania
text: "There's a hole in the system that we immediately have to stop," Interactive Brokers chairman Thomas Peterffy told CNBC.

title: Dow Sets New High; Tilray & Twilio Beat
text: Cannabis supply giant Tilray (TLRY) is up 14% in the late market, following a 9% sell-off in regular day trading.

title: Is inflation around the corner?
text: Concerns about inflation grow after PPI is up more than expected in January. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Guy Adami, Tim Seymour, Dan Nathan and Karen Finerman.

title: Interest rates will continue to rise, but don't blame it all on inflation, economists say
text: As confidence in the economy builds, interest rates should continue their march higher.

title: Retail Sales Showed A Sharp Increase In January
text: Retail sales picked up in January, showing a 5.3% increase over the previous month, according the most recent report by the U. S. Census Bureau.

title: Hedge Fund Diaries: Who Was Buying Your Stocks?
text: SEC 13Fs reveal trades from months ago, but also patterns of long-term bullish behavior.

title: Stocks futures little changed ahead of initial jobless claims data
text: Stock futures were quiet on Wednesday evening.

title: There's going to be a lot of competition in EV space: Paul Hickey
text: Bespoke's Paul Hickey says if every automaker starts to make electric vehicles, it will create competition, and that he's more focused on the suppliers. He joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss.

title: Earnings Expectations Are Too Low, Says Adams
text: Feb.17 -- Gina Martin Adams, Bloomberg Intelligence chief U.S. equity strategist, talks about earnings, inflation and the U.S. economy on "Bloomberg Markets: The Close."

title: Are U.S. Retail Sales Pointing to an Economic Comeback?
text: Retail sales in January exceeded estimates as consumers spent their stimulus checks and vaccine rollouts began. Will the spending trend continue, or will inflation be a factor?

title: Key Words: We were ‘dangerously close' to collapse of ‘entire system,' says Interactive Brokers founder ahead of GameStop hearing
text: Thomas Peterffy, founder and chairman of Interactive Brokers Group Inc., on Wednesday explained the dire situation in which the market stood in late January as individual investors on social-media platforms were banding together to send a handful of heavily shorted stocks dramatically higher.

title: Market Extra: Traders are expecting interest rates to rise over 1% by the end of 2024
text: Traders of short-term cash markets are betting that the Federal Reserve will embark on a hiking cycle sooner than it is telegraphing.

title: The Dow Rose 90 Points to a Record, but Warren Buffett Can Only Do So Much
text: Verizon and Chevron stock soared after Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway disclosed large positions in them. Elsewhere in the market, higher rates unnerved growth and tech investors.

title: Fed minutes: Vaccines and fiscal policy expectations... are what is driving asset values: Fed Chair
text: Yahoo Finance's Brian Cheung breaks down the January 27, 2021 Fed meeting minutes. The Federal Reserve discussed the impact of Robinhood and WallStreetBets on GameStop (GME) stock and the equity markets at large in its Jan. 26 and 27 policy-setting meeting, according to minutes released Wednesday.

title: Stock Market Today: Dow Marks New Highs, Tech Makes a Mess
text: Another big day for energy prices (and a little help from Uncle Warren) sent Chevron higher Wednesday, helping to lift the Dow.

title: API reports a nearly 6 million-barrel weekly fall in U.S. crude supplies, sources say
text: The American Petroleum Institute reported late Wednesday that U.S. crude supplies fell by 5.8 million barrels for the week ended Feb. 12, according to sources. The data, which were delayed by a day because of the Presidents Day holiday, also reportedly showed gasoline stockpiles climbed by 3.9 million barrels, while distillate inventories declined by 3.5 million barrels.

title: Mona Mahajan says markets have been 'tremendously strong'
text: Mona Mahajan from Allianz global investors joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss whether she is rotating positions in her portfolio based on markets.

title: Wall Street ends mixed after Dow finds second wind
text: 4:10pm: S&P very nearly flips positive The DJIA roared to life in the afternoon, finishing up 90 points, 0.3%, at 31,613. The Nasdaq ended down 82 points, 0.6%, at 11,966, and the S&P came just short of positive territory, losing 1 point to 3,931.

title: SEC to weigh more transparency to short sale after GameStop frenzy - WSJ
text: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is considering whether to require more transparency of short-selling, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, after last month's social media-driven rally in a handful of stocks like GameStop Corp.

title: The Mysteries of Volatility and Risk
text: By Karl Steiner I don't often write about “volatility” here at Mindfully Investing because mindful investors focus on long-term returns more than the routine ups and downs of the markets.  The standard deviation of return sequences is the most common measure of routine volatility for stocks, bonds, and other asset classes.

title: Dow closes at record high as investors remain optimistic on economic growth
text: US stocks ended mixed on Wednesday, with the Dow closing at a record high and the S&P 500 and Nasdaq paring back earlier gains as investors digested the economic growth outlook. FOMC minutes from the Federal Reserve's January policy-setting meeting were released Tuesday afternoon. The text reiterated to investors that accommodative monetary policy will remain in place for the foreseeable future. Economists from Jefferies said the more interesting part of the minutes was the discussion of risks surrounding the medium-term outlook for the economy.

title: Interactive Brokers' Thomas Peterffy on GameStop hearing
text: Interactive Brokers founder and chairman Thomas Peterffy says there's nobody to blame, but there is a clear problem in the system that caused the massive run in GameStop stock. He joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss.

title: Dow ekes out another record close as other stock indexes falter Wednesday
text: Dow ekes out another record close as other stock indexes falter Wednesday

title: The Economic Case For Prioritizing A U.S.-Taiwan Free Trade Agreement
text: The United States should quickly accept the offer of Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen to enter into negotiations for a Free Trade Agreement.

title: Dow ekes out another record as stocks end mixed
text: Stocks put in a mixed performance Wednesday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average eking out another record close, lifted by gains for shares of Verizon Communications Inc. and Chevron Corp. after Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc. revealed it had taken stakes in both companies last quarter. The Dow rose around 92 points, or 0.3%, to finish near 31,614, according to preliminary figures.

title: Ranking The Historical Returns of Asset Classes
text: By Karl Steiner In January of 2019 and 2020, I published year-in-review posts on the returns performance of various asset classes.  But I have to say, I found those posts distinctly unsatisfying.

title: Economic Report: Inflation worries are back. Here's what you should worry about – and what you shouldn't
text: Some economists and investors are warning about the threat of rising inflation even with the U.S. still struggling to recover from deepest recession ever. What's behind these seemingly sudden inflationary fears and and how big is the threat?

title: Congressional Hearing On GameStop Ahead: What Investors Need To Know
text: On Thursday, Congress is taking its first crack at sorting through the stock market drama surrounding Reddit's WallStreetBets, the trading app Robinhood, hedge fund Citadel Securities and high-flying stocks like GameStop Corp. (NYSE: GME). What Happened?

title: Fed Minutes Show Commitment to Low Rates and Bond Buys, but Some Observers See 'Taper Talk'
text: The document amplified policy makers' expectations that easy-money policies will be appropriate for a while, but changing conditions have led some to question the commitment.

title: Share of U.S. workers holding multiple jobs is rising, new Census report shows
text: The share of Americans working more than one job to make ends meet has been growing over the past two decades, and the pay from second jobs make up a substantial share of workers' earnings, according to a paper published by the U.S. Commerce Department on Wednesday.

title: Citigroup's Catherine Mann on U.S. Stocks and Biden's Agenda
text: Feb.17 -- Citigroup Global Chief Economist Catherine Mann discusses U.S. stocks and President Biden's agenda with Bloomberg's Alix Steel and Guy Johnson on "Bloomberg Markets".

title: ETF Edge, February 17, 2021
text: CNBC's Bob Pisani talks bitcoin and blockchain with Som Seif, founder and CEO of Purpose Investments, Christian Magoon, founder and CEO of Amplify ETFs, and Andrew McOrmond, managing director at WallachBeth Capital.

title: Fed: Pace of recovery depends on virus response
text: CNBC's Rick Santelli and Steve Liesman report on the latest minutes from the most recent Fed meeting.

title: Fed minutes highlight intention to keep rates low: Stifel chief economist
text: Lindsey Piegza, Stifel chief economist, and Larry Adam, Raymond James CIO, join 'Power Lunch' to discuss the recent Fed minutes and what it says about the Fed's outlook as the coronavirus pandemic continues.

title: Fed minutes highlight willingness to steer past coming inflation
text: Facing a still-scarred economy that may need an extended time to recover fully, Federal Reserve officials last month debated how to lay the groundwork for the public to accept coming higher inflation, and also the need to "stay vigilant" for signs of stress in buoyant asset markets, according to minutes of the U.S. central bank's Jan. 26-27 policy meeting.

title: U.S. Retail Sales Show Sharpest Gain in Seven Months
text: Feb.17 -- U.S. retail sales beat all estimates in January, surging 5.3%, with fresh stimulus checks helping spur a rebound in household demand. Bloomberg's Michael McKee breaks down the numbers on "Bloomberg Markets.

title: The Fed: Fed officials agreed medium-term prospects for the economy had improved: minutes
text: Minutes of the Federal Reserve's January meeting show officials were more optimistic about the future prospects for the economy.

title: Why Nancy Tengler says bonds are riskier than stocks right now
text: CNBC's Jon Fortt discusses the bond market versus the stock market with Nancy Tengler of Laffer Tengler and Marko Papic of the Clocktower Group.

title: How Congress will focus on GameStop mania in hearing
text: CNCB's Jon Fortt discusses the upcoming GameStop hearing with Rep. Brad Sherman (D-Calif.

title: Fed officials see economy 'far from' where it needs to be, meaning easy policy won't change soon, minutes show
text: The Federal Open Market Committee on Wednesday released minutes from its Jan. 26-27 policy meeting.

title: Ark's Cathie Wood on 'deep value' stocks
text: CNBC's Scott Wapner and Bob Pisani are joined by Ark Invest founder, CIO and CEO Cathie Wood to discuss the impact of rising rates, adding Palantir and more.
